cluster_relations.rel_desc: Caterpillars display a variety of body shapes.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a taxon or organism group shows variation across individuals or species in a specific morphological attribute or dimension (e.g., shape, size, color).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Caterpillars display a range of body sizes.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a taxon or organism group shows variation across individuals or species in a specific morphological attribute or dimension (e.g., shape, size, color).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Caterpillars display a variety of body colors.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a taxon or organism group shows variation across individuals or species in a specific morphological attribute or dimension (e.g., shape, size, color).

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Some caterpillars show twig mimicry as a behavior.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism or life stage displays or performs a specific behavior or behavioral strategy (e.g., camouflage, mimicry).

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Purpose: to camouflage themselves from predators

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Some caterpillars show leaf mimicry as a behavior.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism or life stage displays or performs a specific behavior or behavioral strategy (e.g., camouflage, mimicry).

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Purpose: to camouflage themselves from predators

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a taxon or organism group shows variation in a specific morphological attribute or dimension (e.g., shape, size, color) across individuals or species.
args.justification: The three relations all link caterpillars to different morphological attributes (shapes, sizes, colors) and describe variation across species. The existing name 'exhibits_morphological_variation_in' is slightly awkward and redundant given that the object already encodes the attribute dimension. Normalizing to 'exhibits_morphological_variation' yields a cleaner, reusable predicate while preserving the same semantics; the class and group remain appropriate and unchanged.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a taxon or organism group shows variation in a specific morphological attribute or dimension (e.g., shape, size, color) across individuals or species.
executed_decisions.justification: The three relations all link caterpillars to different morphological attributes (shapes, sizes, colors) and describe variation across species. The existing name 'exhibits_morphological_variation_in' is slightly awkward and redundant given that the object already encodes the attribute dimension. Normalizing to 'exhibits_morphological_variation' yields a cleaner, reusable predicate while preserving the same semantics; the class and group remain appropriate and unchanged.
